item.description:
*this event is full but if you want to get on the wait list or register your interest for a repeat of this event, please send me an email to let me know! thx, lisaf*

Interested in learning about permaculture design but not sure if you can invest in a full-blown design course?

Then the Permaculture Design Seminar Series might be a good fit for you. In a small group setting (no more than 10-12 people) and at an affordable price, work with local permaculture designer and organizer Lisa Fernandes on a real design project close to Portland. We will meet for 3-hour sessions and you can enroll in one or more modules. It is expected that the whole series will be about 3-4 modules long (depending on the property) stretching between April and July. Design and some implementation strategies will be covered. The series will repeat with a different project if there is enough interest.

The series is suited to those who are new to permaculture or are ready to apply some of their permaculture knowledge to a "live" project.

Module #1: The Lay of the Land
We will be meeting on-site with our "client" in South Portland to walk their 1/2 acre property near Willard Square and review their wants, needs and goals. We will gather data and discuss the completed client questionnaire while assembling a list of site assets and site challenges that need to be addressed in any design recommendations. We will begin brainstorming design ideas. There will be a couple of hours of reading (mostly online) assigned before the first module.

Module #2: No-Dig Garden Beds and Plant Selection Strategies [Date TBD soon]
Module #3: Water in the Landscape and Zone 0 (The Home) [Date TBD soon]
Module #4: [Being Developed Based on Specific Site - Date TBD soon]

We will meet from 5:30 to 8:30 with a short 15 min break part-way through. We can either bring potluck food to share or chip in on something to share. Beverages provided. Bring your potluck kit either way.

Payment Note: I have turned on the Amazon payments tool that the meetup site offers because it is the only way to require payment as a condition of making a 'yes' RSVP. This isn't my preferred method BUT in order to keep admin costs down and avoid having to manage checks/deposits/chasing non-payments & no-shows....well, you know. If you are REALLY serious about attending this but cannot use plastic, please email me and we can make arrangements.
